snippet: In withdrawing her name, Susan E. Rice, the ambassador to the United Nations, removed a major source of tension between the White House and Congressional Republicans.
abstract: Susan E Rice, ambassador to United Nations, withdraws her name from consideration to succeed Hillary Clinton as Secretary of State; decision removes major source of tension between White House and Congressional Republicans, who had deeply criticized Rice for comments she made about Benghazi, Libya, attack, and clears way for Pres Obama to nominate Sen John Kerry.

byline.contributor: Helene Cooper and Jennifer Steinhauer contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: In withdrawing her name, Susan E. Rice, the ambassador to the United Nations, removed a major source of tension between the White House and Congressional Republicans.

headline.seo: Rice Ends Bid to Succeed Clinton as Secretary of State
headline.main: Rice Ends Bid for Secretary of State, and Fight With G.O.P.
headline.print_headline: Under Fire, Rice Ends Bid to Succeed Clinton As Secretary of State
